message_1: A newspaper wants to estimate the mean income of its readers. A random sample of 40 readers shows a mean income of $50,000 with a standard deviation of $8,000. Calculate a 95% confidence interval for the mean income of all readers of the newspaper.
message_2:
To calculate a 95% confidence interval for the mean income of all readers of the newspaper, we will use the following formula:

Confidence Interval = Sample Mean ± (Critical Value * Standard Error)

where:

Sample Mean = $50,000 (given)
Sample Size (n) = 40 (given)
Standard Deviation (σ) = $8,000 (given)
Critical Value (Z) = 1.96 (for a 95% confidence interval)

First, we need to calculate the Standard Error (SE):

Standard Error (SE) = σ / √n
SE = $8,000 / √40
SE ≈ $1,265.49

Now, we can calculate the margin of error:

Margin of Error = Critical Value * Standard Error
Margin of Error = 1.96 * $1,265.49
Margin of Error ≈ $2,480.36

Finally, we can calculate the 95% confidence interval:

Lower Limit = Sample Mean - Margin of Error
Lower Limit = $50,000 - $2,480.36
Lower Limit ≈ $47,519.64

Upper Limit = Sample Mean + Margin of Error
Upper Limit = $50,000 + $2,480.36
Upper Limit ≈ $52,480.36

So, the 95% confidence interval for the mean income of all readers of the newspaper is approximately $47,519.64 to $52,480.36.
